section_1_key_concepts.overview: Probability is the maths of chance and uncertainty. Essential for statistics and decision making.
learning_objectives: Use tree diagrams for combined events

key_terms.definition: Something that happens (e.g. flipping a coin)
Events that cannot happen at the same time

section_2_detailed_explanations.heading: Calculating Probability
section_2_detailed_explanations.content: P(Event) = Number of successful outcomes / Total number of possible outcomes. Probabilities can be fractions, decimals or percentages.

section_3_worked_examples.question: A bag has 3 red and 7 blue balls. P(Red)?
